<setup: dim room, a man deep in thought, tense mood>
<optional narration: A moment of realization.>
Man: “They’ve wept over it and grown used to it!”

<blank line>

Man: “What if I am wrong?”  
Man: “What if man isn’t a scoundrel?”  
Man: “Then all this is just prejudice!”  

---
<setup: same room, man pacing, conflicted emotions>
<optional narration: Doubts swirl in his mind.>
Man: “No barriers exist… it’s all as it should be.”  
Man: “Could it really be that simple?”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The narrator reflects on the nature of humanity, questioning whether the perception of man as a scoundrel is merely a prejudice.
